page.title: 13Ravenfield Park. (Old Hall)
page.content: {Ravenfield Hall,}now burnt down, was built by the ancient family of{Westby in the{17th century.}The park was enclosed at the same time. In the 2nd half of the 18th century,{Elizabeth {Parkin and Walter Oborne,}successors to Westby built a{new church, enlarged the{hall}and park and added a new {stable. John Carr}was the architect. The park contained fish ponds of unknown origin, good trees and a herd of deer. In{1920 the hall}and park was sold, the estate broken up and decay set in. It was{abandoned}in{1930. During the{2nd world war}the{army}used the park as a training ground. {Prisoners of war}were held there later. In{1945,}Mr Heath bought the land for{farming.}In 1972 Mr Heath's son sold the pond part of the park to the{Phoenix and Aldwarke Social {Service club}of B.Steel Rotherham.
